text:
My Bottom Line:
Fruity and mineral, this Bockbier shares apricot sweetness and earthy bitterness in a flavorful but perhaps clunky organization.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A slice of foam tops the hazy dark blond.
-Flavor rendering is not as smooth as it could be.
-The earthy hop bitterness could be bolder to balance out the residual sugars.
-This is not the same level of quality as their year-round Lagerbier.

On tap at the butcher shop.
On tap at the brewery butchers bakery clear mid brown colour lasting cream head. Malty brown malty unsubtle but fun. Drunk with some sausage senf and Montreal. Ok. Lots of residual sugar. Sweet. Ok.

(tap at the brewery) Hazy, orange-amber colour with an off-white foamy layer. Slightly yeasty, juicy malty aroma with fruity accents of apricots, peaches and citrus, herbal hoppy background. Bitter-sweet flavour, medium bodied, calm on carbon, quasi ungespundet. Dry malt character with fruity and floral notes; drying hops towards the lasting herbal-spicy and fruity finish. Very good. 19.XI.16

Buegelverschlußflae (1000ml, purchased at the famous butchers shop in Uetzing):Deep golden, hazy, very stable creamy off-white head; moderate to solid nose of pale malt with a delicate toasty touch, mild but distinctive herbal-hoppy background; moderate to solid sweet-bitter flavour, medium bodied and pretty soft; robust and lingering bitter-sweet pale-malty and hoppy finish with a mild, but distinctive and drier bitter aftertaste. Great Bock, tasty and extremely well balanced, even suitable for vegetarians...

Hazy amber with a large white head. Aroma had floral hops and Munich malt. Flavor was quite full with malty and floral notes. Although sweet it still finished bitter from the fresh floral hops. Lovely interpretation of the style.

Hazy golden with little white head. Aroma is fruits, orange, mandarin, yeasts, flour, bread. Taste is much fruity sourness with a dark spicy hinge, phenols, and a little alcohol. Not so smooth, a little cloggy. Ok.

Tap. Hazy orange color with white head. Aroma is fruity, orange, Fruchtgummi. Taste is bready, Fruchtgummi, grassy, quite warming and alcoholic, but with a nice portion of hops. Silky mouthfeel. Nice Bock!
Tap. Cloudy amber, golden cream. Great fruity malt and hop nose. Earthy, minerally dry up front, fruity notes, grassy, herbal, primitiv, real - Dry yet chewy, moreish.
Das Bier ist Bernsteinfarben bis orange, leicht trüb mit weißem Schaum. Es ist malzbetont, leicht karamellig und brotig. Im Abgang frisch würzig, leicht bitter und alkoholisch. Gutes Bockbier!

At the source in Uetzing in Franconia-Germany. Pours a bit lighter than the regular lager (?), properly orange skin color kind of semi-filtered appearance, very vivid. Frothy off-white foamy head. Nose: balanced woody notes with caramel and butter cookies dominating the scene. Some melon too. Mouth: frizzier than the lager sister, alcohol character, fat too sugary (for me), molasses. Meant to warm you up at winter time!

Draught @ Hausbrauerei Reichert (Uetzinger Metzgerbräu), Stublanger Str. 2, Bad Staffelstein-Uetzing, Bavaria Germany 96231. [ As Uetzinger Metzgerbräu Maibock ].Unclear medium orange color with a small to average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, pale malt, caramel, moderate to light heavy hoppy, grass, orange - citrus, fruity. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration, orange, sweet malt, hoppy bitter. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20140512]

1L bottle purchased and consumed at the brewery in Nov. 2013: Lightly hazed golden orange. Marmalade, piecrust, flowers, hay dust, nectar, rustic yeast and minerals comprise the appealing aroma. Lush carbonation. Initially juicy with a blend of marmalade richness and flower nectar. Hops become increasingly firm, taking on a woody, fennel seed spiciness beneath the elegant floral softness. Delectable fluffy haylike starches and vanilla cake accents fill out the body, yet despite the malt girth, things remain quite clean and the sugars well managed. Melanoidins bounce along gracefully amid the cakey substantialness. Zero alcohol is noted. Fresh sliced peach, fuzz and all, nicely mirrors the gentle scratch of minerals as a profusion of lemon candy and saliva-inducing hop oils supplement the core with ideal brightness. Finishes well-textured with notes of hay dust embracing the luscious nectar flavors and edgeless hoppiness. I was surprised I wasnt picking up any of the plastic notes (the dirty kind) that Ernest was at the time, as he and I usually are hypersensitive to those characters. I found it to be a pretty clean and  assertively hoppy, yet well-balanced and luscious bockbier which I found difficult to stop drinking.
user_location: Blue Ridge Mountains, North Carolina, USA

text: 1 Liter Bottle from the Brewery. Ins Glas ergießt sich ein leicht trübes bernsteinfarbenes Bier mit ordentlicher Schaumkrone. Geruch fruchtig malzig, Karamell, leicht alkoholisch. Geschmack nach Karamell, malzig, würzig, leicht alkoholisch.

A sweet fruit / honey dew melon and sugar experience with mineral / game-y notes. Rich, full-bodied melanoidin mouthfeel with soft carbonation. Sweet and sugary with peppery acids. Crisp honey / sugar / mineral finish. From 1L bottle at Metzgerbrau.

1L bottle from the meat shop in Uetzing.
Head is initially average sized, frothy, white, mostly lasting.
Body is dark yellow to light amber.
Aroma is lightly malty (cookie), lightly to moderately hoppy (flowers), with notes of dried mango/pineapple, plastic, taffy/gum, alcohol.
Flavor is moderately to heavily sweet, lightly acidic, lightly bittter.
Finish is lightly to moderately sweet, lightly acidic, moderately bitter.
Medium to full body, watery/syrupy texture, lively carbonation, moderately alcoholic. 
The aroma isnt terribly clean, but there is some nice fruity-cookie notes in there too. Nice balance, reasonably lip-smacking and full-flavored. Not as good as Lagerbier, but nice.
